examples: All the students passed the test.
I want all of the cake.
He knows all the answers to the trivia questions.
Todos os alunos passaram no teste.
Ele sabe todas as respostas para as perguntas de trivia.

suggested: Why don't scientists trust atoms? Because they make up everything! (All puns aside, that's a good one)
The thought of feeling like all the odds are against us can be disheartening.
It's frustrating when all our hard work goes unnoticed or unappreciated.
Did you know that the word 'all' comes from the Old English word eall, which means 'the whole quantity or extent'?
There's no specific smell associated with 'all', but the scent of completeness and satisfaction can be comforting.
The physical sensation of holding all the cards or having all the answers can be a sign of power and control.
The concept of all can be connected to the idea of inclusivity, unity, and wholeness.
